Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of missing women by stating that five women went missing, when in reality only one woman was reported missing.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the police are suppressing news of the incidents.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the police are intentionally suppressing news of the incidents, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that the missing Visalia woman's case was widely reported and not suppressed by police.
